title: Electric potential - PE change of proton-field

content.question: Points <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> are separated by a distance of <math alttext="5 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and located in a uniform electric field of magnitude <math alttext="1000 volts per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1000</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V/m</mtext></math> directed in the <math alttext="positive y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></mpadded></math>-direction, as shown in the figure. The line between Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> makes an angle of <math alttext="37 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>37</mn><mo>°</mo></math> to the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis. When a proton (of charge <math alttext="positive lowercase e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi></mpadded></math>) is moved by an external force from Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> to Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, what is the change in electric potential energy of the proton-field system?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
